adjectives.description: enunciable (comparative more enunciable, superlative most enunciable)

entries.meaning: (of words, linguistic expressions, etc.) Capable of being distinctly enunciated or pronounced in speech.
(of ideas, thoughts, etc.) Capable of being expressed clearly in language.
examples: Even scientific propositions regarding entities like "strange attractors" or "quarks" are not understood by many peopleâ€”and are accepted as real only when these abstruse ideas, often enunciable only as mathematical equations, have been translated into "practical results."
